page.title: 11THE NICKY LINE
page.content: The name Nicky comes either from the parish of St Nicholas which covers much of Harpenden or because of its size from the word knickerbocker. It was a single track railway opened in 1877 to link the Midland and London, Midland Scotland railways. It was never very successful financially due to competition from road transport. An experiment using a 'ro_railer' which could travel on both rails and roads did not attract the extra passengers needed. The line was closed to passengers in 1947 and used by a local Hemelite Company to transport ash from Harpenden to its brick company in Hemel Hempstead. The line was finally closed in 1979. During 1983_4 the track was taken up and a cycleway was laid linking Redbourn and Harpenden, as part of a Youth Opportunity Scheme.
